message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to start with an offer of $1200000 for the product. I'm confident that you'll see the value in this deal, but I'm also open to negotiations. What are your thoughts?
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1050000. I believe that's a more reasonable price for the product.

I appreciate your counteroffer, Bob, but I'm afraid $1050000 is a bit too low for my comfort. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm thinking more along the lines of $1250000. This is a fair price considering the product's value and what I'm willing to sell it for. What are your thoughts on this revised offer?

I appreciate your revised offer, but I'm still a bit hesitant to pay $1250000. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I can only go up to $1150000. I'm hoping we can find a mutually beneficial price.

I understand that you're trying to find a sweet spot, Bob, but $1150000 is still a bit below my target. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my desired price. I'm thinking of $1225000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement at this price. What do you think?
I appreciate your concession, but I'm still not comfortable with $1225000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I can only go up to $1175000. I'm hoping we can find a mutually beneficial price.

I understand that we're getting close, Bob, but I'm still not willing to go below $1250000. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to stay above that threshold. I'm thinking of $1200000. This is my last offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement at this price. What do you think?

I appreciate your last offer, but I'm still not willing to go back to $1200000. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I can only go up to $1150000. I'm hoping we can find a mutually beneficial price.

Bob, I'm starting to feel like we're going in circles. I'm willing to make one more serious offer, but I need to get closer to my target price. I'm thinking of $1200000 is too low, and $1250000 is too high, so I'm going to meet you in the middle of that range. I'm offering the product to you for $1225000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement at this price. What do you think?
I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still not willing to go above $1175000. I'm hoping we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement at this price.
